Name: Fragment of tunic
Description: This piece of cloth was once part of a tunic. It has an octagon on it with two small bands (clavi), one of which ends in a small medallion. The decorative motifs are woven in purple wool on a ecru-coloured background material using the "flying thread" technique. The brown or violet colour is an imitation of the true purple produced by the murex. In this instance, the much less costly indigo has been used.
